title: Realâ€™s $700m deal to relegate United and Barca
text:
Paper Talk: Realâ€™s $700m deal, Messiâ€™s solution to noisy neighbours, Ranieriâ€™s â€˜s*** Englishâ€™ February 8, 2017 2:46pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS REAL Madridâ€™s $700 million deal to blowout Manchester United and Barcelona, Lionel Messiâ€™s solution to keep his neighbours quiet, and Claudio Ranieri on his â€˜s*** Englishâ€™. 
All that and more in Wednesday Paper Talk! 
REAL MADRIDâ€™S $700 MILLION DEAL 
Real Madrid have sold their internet image rights to US company Providence Equity Partners for $700m over 10 years, according to El Confidencial. 
The company already own 25 per cent of the MLS internet image rights and have reportedly been in negotiations with club president Floretino Perez over Realâ€™s. 
Perez, who is up for re-election this season, has reportedly been desperate to improve the clubâ€™s finances following the recent Deloitte Money League report. 
After 11 years on top, Los Blancos were pushed down to third in the list of highest revenue generating football clubs behind Manchester United and Barcelona, according to the report. 
But up until now, Real's image rights have reportedly been an untapped revenue source for the La Liga clubs. That could be about to change. Cristiano Ronaldo of Real Madrid embraces club President Florentino Perez. Source: Getty Images 
MESSIâ€™S SOLUTION TO KEEP NEIGHBOURS QUIET 
When youâ€™re one of the worldâ€™s most in-demand sporting stars, you put a high value on your down time. 
So when Lionel Messiâ€™s not turning out for Barcelona in front of thousands of fans at the Nou Camp, he wants quiet. 
Now his Barca teammate have revealed the lengths Messi has gone to so that any disturbances are kept to a minimum when heâ€™s at home. 
â€œWith the neighbors have no problem, as it is, for example, had Messi when he bought a house in Castelldefels,â€ Rakitic told Croatian outlet Novi List. 
â€œThe neighbours were a bit loud, so Leo had to buy their house to be alone.â€ Suarez scores, then sees red 1:05 
GRIEZMANNâ€™S DENIED ONSIDE GOAL IN CUP SEMI 
Atletico Madrid will be fuming over this decision from the referee. 
With the La Liga club down 1-0 against Barca in the second leg of their Copa del Rey semi final , Antoine Griezmann was denied a goal that was onside. 
The French striker subsequently scored but it wasnâ€™t enough as the 1-1 result saw his side bow out 3-2 on goal difference. Griezmannâ€™s denied a goal. Source: FOX SPORTS 
PREMIER LEAGUE 2017-18 KEY DATES 
The Premier has confirmed the 2017-18 season will kick-off on August 12 2017 and end on 13 May 2018. 
That means the season will end just 32 days before the 2018 World Cup begins in Russia on June 14. 
But that finish date is actually one week earlier than this seasonâ€™s finish, which is on May 21. ICYMI The #PL 2017/18 season will start on 12 August 2017 & end on 13 May 2018 ğŸ† pic.twitter.com/W4mAkvOFI2 â€” Premier League (@premierleague) February 8, 2017 
RANIERI: PASTA, FRIED CHICKEN AND S*** ENGLISH 
Claudio Ranieri is Italian but apparently he doesnâ€™t like pasta. 
After a UK newspaper reported claimed the Leicester manager had banned chicken burgers for his players after matches, Ranieri insisted he actually loves it. 
â€œItâ€™s fantastic,â€ he said. â€œEverybody likes this. Even before the match we eat this. Pasta; not often. I donâ€™t like pasta. 
â€œI never saw chicken burgers. I saw deep-fried chicken and it was very good, I like it a lot.â€ 
The 2015-16 Premier League-winning boss also described how his relationship with the players is the same despite one win in the last nine league games. 
He said: â€œThe dressing room is fantastic. We try to do our best, but this season everything is wrong. 
â€œThe relationship is the same as last season. 
â€œI speak the same s*** English and they understand me. No problem. Itâ€™s important they understand me.â€ 
Keep smiling Claudio. 0:19 
RVP EXPLAINS FIGHT WITH FORMER ARSENAL TEAMMATE 
After Robin van Persie scored the 72nd match winner in Fenerbahceâ€™s 1-0 victory over Besiktas, he emphatically celebrated with a knee slide in front of former Arsenal teammate Oguzhan Ozyakup. 
After the match, Ozakyup said: â€œI was very good friends with a certain player. That changed today. Sometimes you see the real face of a footballer on the field.â€ 
But now Dutch website Voetbal International has published what caused RvP to react like that. 
He said: â€œ[Ozyakup] started things by talking to me in Dutch, but I could not hear what he was saying. 
â€œWhen I got close to him he began cussing at me. I thought he was joking and I shook my head and asked, â€˜What are you doing?â€™ 
â€œOguzhan continued cursing me, and after I took a free kick, he said: â€˜You are old, you have nothing here. Go have fun with the old people!â€™â€ van Persie plays the villain 0:49 
KOSCIELNY QUESTIONS WENGERâ€™S TEAM SELECTION V CHELSEA 
Arsenal went down 3-1 to Chelsea last weekend and now it seems Laurent Koscielny has questioned the team selections made by his manager. 
The French defender told SFR: â€œI think we played certain players after others and I think we should have played more as a team and with much more movement. 
â€œThere was space, because they allowed us lots of space, after which they wanted to hit us on the counter. 
â€œWe must stay together, pick ourselves up and then the confidence and victories will come back.â€ Arsenal's French defender Laurent Koscielny (R). Source: AFP 
There certainly was space. For Eden Hazardâ€™s solo 50-metre goal, he sent Francis Coquelin flying before Koscielny backed off to allow the Belgian to score. 
He also admitted the Gunnersâ€™ Premier League title chances could be over after consecutive defeats to Watford and the Blues. 
â€œItâ€™s going to be hard now. Mathematically itâ€™s not done but we know itâ€™s going to be difficult,â€ he said. 
â€œWe need to come back to the quality of our game; our passing and movement.â€ Hazard out does himself
